response.message:
The problem with being a contributor is keeping interest in doing it.

To date, I have one published piece on the Gaming blog.   I have another that is almost done, it just needs images and touching up.

However, it'll likely remain that way unless someone else touches it up as I've lost interest in it. :/
I like the idea, as it should give yet another dimension to the communities. Out of interest, is it all powered by WordPress MU/MS/multisite?

I think Stackoverflow is so great because it has very good working quality mechanisms (votes, closes, editing). Those are totally missing for blog posts.

Have a look at 
http://gaming.blogoverflow.com/2011/06/17/redstone-101 This posting is spreading missinformation on logic gates (and it is hard to understand for people not knowing Minecraft).

This is a shame because it is obvious that writing a blog post takes quite a bit of time and efford. But unlike questions and answers there is no way for a normal users to improve the serious mistakes in it.
Okay, I'm inspired and now I'm asking the http://bicycles.stackexchange.com/ community whether or not they want a blog: http://meta.bicycles.stackexchange.com/q/337/76

For crying out loud, Atwood. This all started with your blog, and now you’re bringing it back to blogging?!?!?

That’s pretty cool!

(I also like how you still blog once a month — like you say, sticking to a schedule is more important than having that schedule be of a particular frequency.)
(I’ve just noticed that the author of this blog post *might* not be Jeff Atwood, on account of his name being “Rebecca Chernoff” instead of “Jeff Atwood”.)

@Matt

The community blogs are running on WordPress 3/w multisite, bar the Super User blog which is a separate WP installation.

"Have someone driving the reigns" - AAAAAAHHHHH!!! My eyes!!!! My brain!!! My sensibilities!!! [reign = royalty's time in office. You probably want "rein". But even then, you at most *hold* the reins while driving something else - a cart, a carriage, a wagon. Reins, being flimsy string-like things, really can't be driven.]

@Paul, I am definitely not Jeff. (:

@Martha, oops!  No matter how many times I proofread, *sigh*.
Great idea! But I hate the name. Blog Overflow: It sounds like some sort of affliction.

I asked about this a year ago:

http://meta.stackoverflow.com/questions/52292/any-chance-of-long-form-articles-getting-the-so-se-treatment

Any chance of this introduction of long-form articles into the SE-space being augmented with improved SE-like features or will it just be a classic blog with approved authors?
I agree with @Andrew - I'm not sure I like the name. It has a slightly "something went wrong" to it. How about stackblogs.com instead? It's available and much snappier IMO.
Other than that though - interesting idea! Very interested to see how it plays out.

Security Blog is live - http://security.blogoverflow.com

Get on over there, add it to your RSS feed, tell your pets...

we'll be covering all aspects of security: web applications, encryption, social engineering, physical security, policy and regulatory compliance, audit...
why is it called Blog Overflow? shouldn't it be Blog Exchange ?
Inspiring post thanks for the information I'll surely follow up you for some other great information.
